questions.question_text: A user reports receiving constant, unwanted pop-ups and being unable to close the browser window. These issues have impacted the user's productivity and may have caused the user's files to be altered. Which of the following should a technician do to address these issues with minimal impact to the user?

discussion.content:
D. Perform a full-system, antivirus scan and check browser notifications.
Given the symptoms of unwanted pop-ups and potential file alterations, it's likely that the user's system is infected with malware. A full-system antivirus scan will help to identify and remove any malicious software that may be causing the issues.

Additionally, checking browser notifications can help to identify and disable any malicious extensions or settings that may be triggering the pop-ups.

While options like System Restore, reimaging the system, or checking disk partition size might be necessary in more severe cases, a full-system antivirus scan and browser check are the most appropriate initial steps in this scenario.

Google Gemini

choices.B: Wipe the computer and install a new copy of the OS.
choices.A: Use System Restore to recover the OS files.
choices.C: Identify whether the disk partition table has been reduced in size.
choices.D: Perform a full-system, antivirus scan and check browser notifications.

discussion.content:
B. BitLocker
BitLocker is a full disk encryption tool built into Windows that encrypts the entire contents of a drive, making it inaccessible to unauthorized users. This provides strong protection against data theft and unauthorized access, even if the device is lost or stolen.

questions.question_text: A customer wants to make sure the data is protected and secure on a Windows laptop's hard drive. Which of the following is the best solution?

Employees at comptia.org are reporting getting a usual amount of emails from a coworker. A technician discovers the emails were sent from the following address: john@cOmptia.org.

Which of the following social engineering attacks is this an example of?

discussion.content:
The scenario describes an Insider Threat. Answer B

Here's why the other options are not the best fit:

Whaling: This targets high-level executives or individuals with access to sensitive information. The email doesn't necessarily target a specific person at CompTIA.
Phishing: This impersonates a legitimate entity to trick recipients into revealing personal information or clicking malicious links. The email doesn't come from an external source.
Vishing: This uses voice calls (phone) to impersonate a trusted source. The email is a written communication.
Evil Twin: This creates a fake Wi-Fi network that appears legitimate to steal data. The scenario doesn't involve Wi-Fi networks.
An insider threat involves a current or former employee who intentionally or unintentionally compromises the security of an organization. In this case, someone with access to an internal email account ([email address removed]) is sending unusual emails, suggesting a potential misuse of their credentials or a compromised account.

Google Gemini

C
Sending email address is different

questions.question_text: A web developer installs and launches a new external web server. Immediately following the launch, the performance of all traffic traversing the firewall degrades substantially. Which of the following considerations was overlooked?

discussion.content:
B. Quality of service
Quality of Service (QoS) is a network management technique that prioritizes certain types of traffic over others. In this scenario, the new web server, being a high-traffic application, requires priority over other network traffic. Without QoS, the increased traffic from the web server can overload the network, leading to degraded performance for all users.

By implementing QoS, the network administrator can prioritize the web server's traffic, ensuring that it receives the necessary bandwidth and resources to function optimally.

Google Gemini

B 
Quality of service (QoS) is the use of mechanisms or technologies that work on a network to control traffic and ensure the performance of critical applications with limited network capacity. It enables organizations to adjust their overall network traffic by prioritizing specific high-performance applications.

questions.question_text: A technician is setting up a network printer for a customer who has a SOHO router. The technician wants to make sure the printer stays connected in the future and is available on all the computers in the house. Which of the following should the technician configure on the printer?

discussion.content:
B. Static IP
Assigning a static IP address to the printer ensures that its IP address remains constant, even after reboots or power cycles. This makes it easier for other devices on the network to locate and connect to the printer.

Here's why the other options aren't suitable:

DNS settings: DNS is used to resolve domain names to IP addresses. While it's important for network connectivity, it's not necessary for a printer to have its own DNS settings.
WWAN: WWAN (Wireless Wide Area Network) is a technology used for cellular data connections. It's not relevant to a local network printer.
Metered connection: Metered connections are used to optimize data usage on mobile networks. They're not applicable to a local network printer.

Google Gemini
